decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Painter's Servant in combination with Grindstone to mill the opponent's deck. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur artifacts from the graveyard while cards like Mox Opal and Grim Monolith provide ramp. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will for protection and Urza's Saga for additional artifact synergy. The overall goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with mill effects, ultimately leading to a win through deck depletion.

The deck revolves around using Painter's Servant to change all cards in the opponent's library to a chosen color, then using Grindstone to make them mill out their entire deck. The deck also includes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to help with card draw and stocking up artifacts for Urza's Saga. With a combination of powerful artifact spells and counterspells like Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble its combo and win in a single turn.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly ramp up mana using artifacts like Chrome Mox and Trinisphere, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck then aims to close out the game with aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Fury, backed up by powerful removal spells like Sundering Eruption. The inclusion of The One Ring and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds additional versatility and power to the deck's strategy. Ultimately, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive elements.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively with Eldrazi creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By using powerful lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Tomb, you can quickly deploy your threats and overwhelm your opponent. In addition, cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal can provide you with the mana needed to cast your larger Eldrazi spells. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game until you secure the victory.

The main concept of this Canadian Threshold aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the game through efficient use of card selection and interaction spells like Lightning Bolt, Delver of Secrets, Brainstorm, and Force of Will. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Wasteland while building up threats like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Questing Druid provide additional versatility and options for dealing with various matchups. The deck's consistency and speed make it a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on cheating out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier by using the combo of Show and Tell and Omniscience. It also uses cards like Cunning Wish and Sneak Attack to further enhance its combo potential. The deck includes counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. The mana base includes lands like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb to ramp up quickly. Overall, the key strategy is to quickly get out powerful creatures onto the battlefield using the Show and Tell combo.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then cheat those creatures into play using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. With key pieces like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats early in the game. The inclusion of disruption like Thoughtseize and Daze helps protect the combo pieces, while cards like Polluted Delta and Wasteland provide mana fixing and disruption against opposing decks. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast and aggressive reanimation strategy to win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Animate Dead, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Daze to protect the combo. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty provide powerful threats, while Troll of Khazad-dûm can be a versatile option. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and additional filtering. The deck aims to win the game through a powerful reanimation strategy while controlling the opponent's plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing control cards such as Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Batterskull or Kaldra Compleat. The creatures Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Plagon, Lord of the Beach provide additional threats and card advantage. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection and drawing cards. The mana base includes dual lands for flexibility and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and powerful creatures equipped with potent equipment.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble and execute the Doomsday combo, which involves careful deck manipulation to stack your deck in a specific order to win the game. It utilizes various cantrips and card draw spells to dig through the deck efficiently, while also including disruption such as force of will and thoughtseize to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Thassa's Oracle are crucial to the combo's success, providing the necessary pieces to close out the game once the combo is established.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing ramp with cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to quickly cast powerful threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland, Chalice of the Void, and Sowing Mycospawn helps to control the board and hinder the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with its Eldrazi creatures while maintaining disruption and control elements.

The main concept of this Combo - Painter deck is to use cards like Painter's Servant and Grindstone to quickly mill the opponent's library. Cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer help to tutor for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Pyroblast and Lightning Bolt, as well as artifacts like Ensnaring Bridge to control the opponent's creatures. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a win.

The main goal of this combo deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with creatures and key cards, then use cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy to mill your entire library, triggering effects like Dread Return and Reanimate to bring back key creatures like Thassa's Oracle for a game-winning finish. The deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly cast your spells, while also disrupting your opponent with Thoughtseize and Pact of Negation to ensure your combo goes off without a hitch. Timing and sequencing are crucial to executing this all-in strategy effectively.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Torpor Orb and Dress Down to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The key strategy revolves around getting out Phyrexian Dreadnought, which can be easily cheated into play with cards like Force of Will or Lotus Petal. Once Dreadnought is on the field, it can quickly become a powerful threat that the opponent will struggle to deal with. The deck also includes card draw and removal to help maintain control of the game while working towards the win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's mana base using aggressive creatures and powerful artifact spells. By using mana accelerants like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, as well as land disruption cards like Magus of the Moon, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and maintain control of the battlefield. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Minsc & Boo and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker gives the deck additional versatility and the ability to quickly close out games.

The main idea of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing the powerful synergy between Gaea's Cradle and various creatures that benefit from having a high creature count on the battlefield. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Noble Hierarch, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Endurance and Collector Ouphe. By using cards like Natural Order and Elvish Reclaimer, the deck can efficiently tutor for key pieces to further solidify its control over the game.
